parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear brake switch can cause a loss of rear braking ability, leading to a significant reduction in stopping power and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The brake pedal travels all the way down
loss of rear braking ability
brake fluid leakage
melted wiring.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS brake system can cause a loss of braking ability, leading to a significant reduction in stopping power and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: Loss of rear braking ability
brake pedal travels all the way down
inability to slow down safely.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Premature Failure of Compensator and Sprocket
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The premature failure of the compensator and sprocket can lead to catastrophic engine failure, which can cause accidents and potentially result in serious injury or death.
symptoms: Excessive vibration
loud "bang" during hot starts
loud clunk sound from the primary chain case when shutting off the engine.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Loss of Gear Shift and Heel-Toe Shift Levers
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The loss of gear shift and heel-toe shift levers can cause the rider to lose control of the motorcycle, leading to accidents and potentially resulting in serious injury or death.
symptoms: Gear shift and heel-toe shift levers fall off while riding
leaving no mechanism for changing gears.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Harley-Davidson Electronic Throttle Control (ETC) System Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ETC system can cause the motorcycle to suddenly go into limp mode, resulting in a loss of power and speed, which can lead to accidents or leave the rider stranded.
symptoms: The motorcycle suddenly goes into limp mode
speed drops to a low speed (e.g.
15 mph)
and the motorcycle will not accelerate above the low speed
the check engine light comes on
error code PO577 is displayed
cruise control malfunctions.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The vehicle's tendency to pull to the left when hands are taken off the handlebars can cause the bike to cross the center line, leading to accidents or near-misses, and potentially resulting in serious injury or fatality.
symptoms: The bike pulls to the left when constant pressure is not applied to the handlebars
requiring the rider to lean far to the right to maintain a straight course
and may even cross the center line if left uncorrected.
